snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry spoke at a Paris conference on the Iraqi security crisis, as Iran’s supreme leader said the American plan for bombing ISIS was absurd.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says Obama administration is open to talking with Iran on security crisis in Iraq, even after Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said his country will no longer discuss Middle East issues with the United States.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and THOMAS ERDBRINK
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Paris, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran. David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry spoke at a Paris conference on the Iraqi security crisis, as Iran’s supreme leader said the American plan for bombing ISIS was absurd.

headline.main: Kerry Says U.S. Is Open to Talking to Iran, Even as Ayatollah Is Dismissive
headline.print_headline: Kerry Says U.S. Is Open to Talking to Iran, Even as Ayatollah Is Dismissive

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
